basic.description: This course explores the history of systematic theory; methods of phylogenetic analysis including distance, parsimony, and likelihood; classification of the diversity of life; the comparative method; analysis of within species variation.
basic.subject: BSC
basic.title: Systematics

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: BSC 2010, BSC 21010L, BSC 2011, BSC 2011L, CHM 1045, CHM 1045L, CHM 1046, CHM 1046L.
